discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) are used in cybersecurity to detect and respond to potential threats by identifying malicious behaviors, files, or network activity.

In Cisco Secure Endpoint, IOCs can be manually added to improve threat detection for new or evolving attacks.

ðŸ”¹ Why is Option C Correct?

 Cisco Secure Endpoint allows administrators to define custom advanced detections based on specific IOCs (e.g., file hashes, IPs, domains, behaviors).
 This customization enhances malware detection and response by including new threats that may not yet be covered by Ciscoâ€™s global intelligence.

Selected Answer: B
Based on:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/advanced-malware-protection-endpoints/118899-technote-malwareprotection-00.html#anc5
I think B is correct.

choices.D: Modify the base policy within Cisco Secure Endpoint to include simple custom detections.
choices.B: Upload the 10Cs into the Installed Endpoint IOC feature within Cisco Secure Endpoint.
choices.A: Use the initiate Endpoint 1OC scan feature to gather the IOC information and push it to clients.
choices.C: Add a custom advanced detection to include the 1OCs needed within Cisco Secure Endpoint.

questions.question_text: Which action adds IOCs to customize detections for a new attack?

A network administrator received a critical message alert from a Cisco Secure Web Appliance stating that the log partition is at 107% capacity. How does a Cisco Secure Web Appliance respond when its logging partition is full?

choices.B: It suspends logging and reporting functions.
choices.A: It overwrites the oldest log files.
choices.C: It deletes logs older than a configurable age.
choices.D: It archives older logs in a compressed file to free space.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A.

A vulnerability is a weakness or flaw in a system, software, or network that can be exploited by an attacker to compromise the security or functionality of the system. A vulnerability can be caused by a variety of factors, including coding errors, misconfigurations, or design flaws.

An exploit, on the other hand, is a tool or technique used by an attacker to take advantage of a vulnerability and gain unauthorized access or control over the target system. An exploit can be a piece of software, a script, or a command that leverages a vulnerability to execute malicious code or actions on the target system.

Therefore, the difference between a vulnerability and an exploit is that a vulnerability is a weakness that can be exploited by an attacker, while an exploit is the means by which an attacker takes advantage of a vulnerability to compromise the system.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct here

Selected Answer: A
No doubt, the vulnerability creates access to the exploit

questions.question_text: What is the difference between a vulnerability and an exploit?

choices.C: An exploit is a hypothetical event that causes a vulnerability in the network.
choices.D: An exploit is a weakness that can cause a vulnerability in the network.
choices.B: A vulnerability is a hypothetical event for an attacker to exploit.
choices.A: A vulnerability is a weakness that can be exploited by an attacker.

Micro-segmentation secures applications

The answer is A as we setup IPsec tunnels at my castle

Selected Answer: A
You can have DMVPN with BGP with two routers in the HUB, that will create HA in routing.
Also IPSEC VPN supports stateless failover if you have HSRP in the ISR routers and one dies.
A for me.

Selected Answer: A
A for me.

comments.content: Please it's better to leave the answer on the website as it is when you are not sure/have valid reference of your answer, not to confuse people with the wrong answer.
An answer without a valid reference or a good argument is just blind guessing, and does not help anyone to get that ccnp!

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
At first glance, B. seems accurate. However, I cannot find documentation to support that IPSEC VPN tunnels "on-demand spoke technology"

comments.content: Yeah, so why did you select A as your answer?

choices.C: DMVPN supports non-IP protocols, and IPsec VPN only supports IP protocols.
choices.D: DMVPN supports multiple vendors, and IPsec VPN only supports Cisco products.
choices.A: DMVPN supports high availability routing, and IPsec VPN supports stateless failover.
choices.B: DMVPN uses hub-and-spoke topology, and IPsec VPN uses on-demand spoke topology.
